intro: Quamoclit triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils, often found in grassland habitats. Quamoclit triloba is adapted to dry conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
